meanings.definition: To strike with a heavy blow or thud.
meanings.sent1: He whumps the table to show his frustration.
meanings.sent2: The hammer whumps against the wall.
meanings.sent3: The clown whumps the balloon to make it pop in a funny way.
meanings.sent4: The news of the accident whumps into their hearts.
meanings.sent5: The thunder whumps loudly in the distance.

meanings.sent1: The whumps on the door startled her.
meanings.sent2: The whumps of the falling tree echoed through the forest.
meanings.sent3: The whumps of the boxing match could be heard from afar.
meanings.sent4: The whumps of the waves against the shore were calming.
meanings.sent5: The whumps of the bass drum added depth to the music.

meanings.definition: The sound of a heavy blow or thud.
meanings.sent1: The sudden whumps in the night made her jump.
meanings.sent2: The whumps of the falling rocks echoed in the canyon.
meanings.sent3: The whumps of the falling fruit amused the children.
meanings.sent4: The whumps of the closing door signaled the end of the day.
meanings.sent5: The whumps of the heavy rain on the roof were soothing.
